medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced one episode of intense crampy epigastric abdominal pain that resolved by the next day. Similar pain started early last week, initially crampy, dull, and not severe. Over days, the intensity increased, with additional pain in the back and changes in stool and urine color. The pain worsened to the point she was unable to eat, is not associated with eating, and now is throughout her abdomen, especially the lower portion, accompanied by chills and bloating.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diagnosed with MS, chronic Lyme disease, simple renal cyst, and Bartholin gland cyst.
medical_history.family_history: Father with testicular cancer, maternal grandfather with stroke, paternal grandmother with hypertension. No family history of autoimmune disease or headaches.
